threats.title: T-003 Web Server Spoofing
threats.description:
An attacker might set up a fraudulent web server to phish user
credentials or intercept sensitive data.

threats.title: T-008 Fraudulent Order Repudiation
threats.description:
A customer could deny placing an order if insufficient logging and non-
repudiation controls are in place.

threats.title: T-001 (Customer Account Spoofing)
threats.description:
An attacker could impersonate a legitimate customer to place
fraudulent orders or access their order history.

threats.title: T-004 Order Data Tampering
threats.description:
An attacker could modify order details (e.g., items, quantities, prices,
status) in transit or at rest.

threats.title: T-010 Customer PII Disclosure
threats.description: Unauthorized access to customer names, contact details, delivery addresses, and order history.

threats.title: T-013 Sales Data Disclosure
threats.description:
Unauthorized access to sales reports or underlying aggregated sales
data.

threats.title: T-002 Staff Account Spoofing
threats.description:
An attacker could impersonate staff to manipulate order statuses,
access sales reports, or modify menu items and application
configurations.

threats.title: T-003 Web Server Spoofing
threats.description:
An attacker might set up a fraudulent web server to phish user
credentials or intercept sensitive data.

threats.title: T-008 Fraudulent Order Repudiation
threats.description:
A customer could deny placing an order if insufficient logging and non-
repudiation controls are in place.

threats.title: T-009 Staff Action Repudiation
threats.description:
Staff members (Barista, Manager, Administrator) could deny performing
actions if audit logs are insufficient, not immutable, or can be tampered
with.

threats.title: T-014 Web Application Server DoS
threats.description:
An attacker could flood the Web Application Server with excessive
requests, making it unavailable.

threats.title: T-017 Barista/Manager to Administrator Privilege Escalation
threats.description:
A Barista or Manager could exploit a vulnerability to gain Administrator
privileges.

threats.title: T-018 Horizontal Privilege Escalation
threats.description:
Gaining unauthorized access to another user’s account within the same
privilege level.

threats.title: T-015 MongoDB Database DoS
threats.description:
Malicious or poorly optimized queries could overload the database,
making it unresponsive.

due to insecure storage or unencrypted transmission.

or API keys.

threats.title: T-005 Menu Data Tampering
threats.description:
An attacker could alter menu item data (e.g., prices or descriptions)
before it is stored in the database.

threats.title: T-006 Sales Report Tampering
threats.description:
Unauthorized individuals could alter sales data in the MongoDB
Database, leading to falsified reports.

threats.title: T-007 Application Code/Configuration Tampering
threats.description:
Malicious modification of the application’s source code, server
configurations, or environment variables could introduce backdoors or
disable security features.

threats.description:

requests, making it unavailable.
